thread.title: Tourist arrivals grew by 1.8 per cent in June 2015 over June 2014
thread.title_full: Tourist arrivals grew by 1.8 per cent in June 2015 over June 2014

title: Tourist arrivals grew by 1.8 per cent in June 2015 over June 2014
text: Tourist arrivals grew by 1.8 per cent in June 2015 over June 2014 By Divya Sathyanarayanan , ET Bureau | 10 Jul, 2015, 06.55PM IST MUMBAI: India received 5.13 lakh foreign tourist arrival (FTA) during the month of June 2015, registering a growth of 1.8% during the same period last year. In comparison, 5.05 lakh foreign tourists visited the country in June 2014, according to tourism ministry data. FTAs during the period January- June 2015 were 38.45 lakh with a growth of 3.4% over the same period year ago. The government launched the e-Tourist Visa'(eTV) scheme in November last year for nationals of 43 countries. In May, the government extended the scheme to 31 more countries. Under the eTV scheme, a foreign tourist can apply for a visa by uploading his passport and photograph and paying his/her visa fee online. The authorities process the application and send him/her an electronic travel authorisation, or e-visa, through email within 72 hours. The Foreign Exchange Earnings (FEEs) from tourism in the country stood at Rs 8,951 crore during June 2015 as compared to Rs 8,458 crore in June, 2014; registering a growth of 5.8%. India has jumped 13 ranks in the World Economic Forum Travel and Tourism Competitiveness Index, 2015. Top 15 source countries of Foreign Tourist Arrivals in India during June 2015: 1. USA 2. Bangladesh
